snippet: The move follows approval of a separate bill that would crack down on currency manipulation, an issue clouding prospects for a Pacific trade accord.
abstract: Senate votes to take up bill that would give Pres Obama fast-track authority to negotiate Trans-Pacific Partnership trade accord, reversing itself after protracted opposition; passage follows approval of separate legislation that would crack down on foreign currency manipulation, issue that had been hampering progress of fast-track authority; Pres Obama still faces uphill battle on issue in coming weeks.
lead_paragraph: The move follows approval of a separate bill that would crack down on currency manipulation, an issue clouding prospects for a Pacific trade accord.

headline.main: Senate, in Reversal, Begins Debate on Trade Authority
headline.print_headline: In Reversal, Senate Votes to Consider Trade Bill
